page.title: 04BIRDS ON THE RIVER FOWEY
page.content: At different times of the year many species of birds can be seen on the mud and sand flats. {Herons}which nest near St.Winnow can be seen all year round. The occassional{osprey}has been sighted but only on passage. {Lerryn}is well known in the area for the{mallard ducks}which live on the river and visitors often come to feed them. It is also possible to see any of the following birds:- {curlews, sand-pipers, redshanks, {shelducks, mallards, herring-gulls, {black-backed gulls, black-headed {gulls, little-greeb, cormorants and {kingfishers. In very cold weather{green- {finches, red-wings, field-fares and{lapwings}come down to the warmer climate near the river.
